channel.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
channel.description:
i love them but i was thinking why we play them.
We spend weeks or months trying to add a shitty version of what runescape has had for years. why dont we all play runescape?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“Syme, post:48, topic:336098”]People play Runescape Private Servers because:

  1. They are sick of the censored shits of Runescape.
  2. They are sick of paying for membership.
  3. Runescape got slow exp rate.
  4. Runescape is a hard money making game.
  5. Runescape is gay.
  6. Runescape’s staffs are faggots.
  7. Runescape are so sellfish with the f2p noobs.[/quote]1. Agreed, kinda annoying
    2-6. Agreed
  8. They should be lucky that there’s a free version that’s not a trial.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.description:
@Syme wrote:

People play Runescape Private Servers because:

  1. They are sick of the censored shits of Runescape.
  2. They are sick of paying for membership.
  3. Runescape got slow exp rate.
  4. Runescape is a hard money making game.
  5. Runescape is gay.
  6. Runescape’s staffs are faggots.
  7. Runescape are so sellfish with the f2p noobs.

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I started on RSPS because I heard about instant leveling. I wanted to try it out once.

Then pking got shot down. So I never went back.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“f 2 p 2 p f, post:41, topic:336098”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=432480.msg3175107#msg3175107 date=1270769126]
Why do you guys bullshit alot about having accounts lv130+… ffs
[/quote]

To be honest it really isn’t that amazing having a 130+ so the people who flame those who
claim to have an account that level are asbad as those boasting.[/quote]
No, it’s the fact that the noob says it got hacked. THAT’S the problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

jmood128:

We play servers because regular Rune Scape is bull shit now.

that too. rsc is now epicly hard to find, and was saved because of rsps.
runescape2 is becoming more and more hard to update because it is out of date with the normal runescape models.
508 is now here but we just use that for fun.
[hr /]

[quote=“f 2 p 2 p f, post:44, topic:336098”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=432480.msg3176703#msg3176703 date=1270928247]

Why do you guys bullshit alot about having accounts lv130+… ffs

To be honest it really isn’t that amazing having a 130+ so the people who flame those who
claim to have an account that level are asbad as those boasting.

I came to rsps since it was a fun playing around with the different things in runescape,
some of the designs people have come up with amaze me.
Other than that I’m an old rsc/rs player so I don’t like the direction Rs is going.

Has anyone noticed in the years it took zezima to get 1b total exp, the other people
reached 2b in less than even a quarter that time.

some of us don’t play rsps instead we create games and use runescape’s client as our base. As you may know most servers are custom built around the client. So if we wanted to we could make a game and no one would ever know it had the runescape base.

Why on earth would you use a glitchy rsps client or source to create a whole new game?

when you have it in 317, or 508 deob unused condition it is fairly easy to work with. you obviusley don’t understand that the reason it is glitchy is that people use these bulkloads of crap and pile them in the server and client. You should only have to use a few lines of code not hundreds and hundreds of .java files.
[/quote]

Fair enough lets not get off-topic though, otherwise their are plenty of other engines
That could be used to make games, I was just wondering why these ones :P[/quote]
yes but this is by far the easiest

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

some of us don’t play rsps instead we create games and use runescape’s client as our base. As you may know most servers are custom built around the client. So if we wanted to we could make a game and no one would ever know it had the runescape base.

Why on earth would you use a glitchy rsps client or source to create a whole new game?

[/quote]
when you have it in 317, or 508 deob unused condition it is fairly easy to work with. you obviusley don’t understand that the reason it is glitchy is that people use these bulkloads of crap and pile them in the server and client. You should only have to use a few lines of code not hundreds and hundreds of .java files.[/quote]

Fair enough lets not get off-topic though, otherwise their are plenty of other engines
That could be used to make games, I was just wondering why these ones

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @Souls2 Souls`
item.description:
@Souls2 wrote:

I played runescape in 2003 - 2005 then quit. then came back in 2006-07… then quit in 08…

The only reason i would go back and play runescape would be if they added these:

Wilderness back to olden days.
No Trade limits.
Everything back to it was in 2003. It was better in 2003 then it was ever…

If you want proof of me playing in 2003 p.m me.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:5, topic:336098”]Because, your most likely a player of 2008-to now (don’t lie).

If you played from 2003-2007, you would understand why.

Runescape’s concept of their game is completely different then it once was, and even Zezima said Runescape is way to easy to train and earn money, the concept of the game has change drastically.

Why do we play private servers? To have a customized version of Runescape and play with players who miss the old Runescape (sadly there aren’t many players who played old Runescape, 89% of them are liars, and say they did)[/quote]

i swear i started in 2006 and get wat ur talking about and i agree

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

http://forum.runescape.com/forums.ws?103,104,2,60722635,goto,1

Jagex is trying to increase their player mods.

At the subject of trade, I think they have a fair method now of quest points and how long you’ve been friends with someone to increase trade.
If you have 150 quest points and friends for 2 months you can trade 150k.
I think it’s fair.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I found I could talk with alot more people in a better community back then then I can now. Obviously YOU didn’t play then. I saw this game change alot. I had been nearly scammed countless times, scammed even a few. Back to my point though, maybe it was just where I was, I found I could talk to alot more people then I could now. Like in 05 I did alot of mining, and I have some good memories of working my way up to the mining guild, fighting with everyone over those few coal ores under Falador.

See, by late 06 JaGeX realized that botting, scamming, real world stuff ect. was getting out of hand. First, it began with that place in Barb village with those retarded boots and new emotes. Also the safety books and the random event dude that would beat the shit out of you if you didn’t take his book. Remember before they actually set the trade limit, the question marks where added. This revolutionized noobs and brought scamming down, but it didn’t stop real world trading. So they took out the wildy, duel arena, added a Grand Exchange, which is pretty much economy control central. The GE wouldn’t be possible without controlled prices.

Even if there was more macroers, most of them would be found cutting trees, picking flax, or other simple quick tasks that required a basic read on a color type.

And Ok, maybe I don’t have proof of 500k, but alot did quit. That was alot of peoples prime source of income.
Even so, why should I have to wait for a fucking circle to fill up and end up getting 1/5th of their stuff vs the full loot. Maybe they just need to increase there watch on trading stuff, and if a pattern is seen in any form of mass amount of traded money to someone in a single day, or the same kill on a person very consecutively, they could just loose the right. There staff is only about 100, maybe they need to increase player mods.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

reyx7:

1. People played for the shitty graphics.

No they didn’t? Since when would someone look at something and say “Wow what shit graphics, I’m going to play”?

reyx7:

2. Less people botted then. Hence why I said I could have a conversation with someone. The newer community type in runescape just isnt as fun.

Are you fucking kidding me? You obviously wasn’t around in 06-07. Runescape was FULL of macro’s. The player count used to be a lot more higher than it is now. It decreased due to the amount of macro’s being stopped by Jagex.

reyx7:

3.500k People quit with the removal of pking. And this new bounty thing isn’t the same. Why should I have to wait 1 hour for a little circle to be 8/8 just to get ONE of there items, when I could get there inventory in a matter of minutes.

You have no proof of this. Even if you did, the amount of people ‘quitting’ would’ve been the mass amount of botters going inactive/getting banned.

reyx7:

4. If so, why can’t you say “sorry I cannot speak normally. I am muted”

“I can only use Quick Chat”

reyx7:

5. Who cares if it’s controlled by players, It’s still frustrating. I used to make millions just buying willows at varrock and selling them in draynor for a slightly higher amount. And this made alot of money. Now I can do this. Or like planks and steel bars at construction portal. It’s no longer possible for that kind of profit.

Sure it is. Refer to Caseys post.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:30, topic:336098”][quote author=casey. link=topic=432480.msg3175325#msg3175325 date=1270787902]

Prime example of inflation would be the Green D’hide Chaps
Only about a year ago they were around 150k. Now they’re 1.7m. Ridiculous imo.

I wouldn’t really call that inflation.
Back when Jagex released the Gold D’hide treasure trails was a really good source of gold. Years later new easier ways have been added which has resulted in less people doing clues which means less on the market so the price will increase.
[/quote]
Yes but it isn’t just those that have gone up by a significant amount. Things such as the whip which stayed around the 1.6-2m mark for years has increased to around 3m.
Money is so easy to come across on runescape now its lost its value compared to the old days. Maybe the economy isn’t inflated, but it certainly has changed a lot and majority of it isn’t in a good way.

How would this game have improved over time? I can barely play now because they keep updating the fucking graphics.

There is nothing wrong with that, they’re just trying to keep up with the various other MMO’s.

People in rs haven’t been the same. I remember if I went 2 the fishing guild 4 years I could have a fun conversation with a bunch of people.

It was full of bots and nobody spoke except a few people. Just how it is today. Also how does this support your statement of runescape being bad? Jagex can’t help it if somebody doesn’t want to talk to you.

Anyone who didn’t experience classic pking should leave the topic. You don’t remember 12-11-07 like we do. Imagine those people pking, then kicked cuz of update. They probably wanted to resume there fight, but that never happen. And why is this? To stop gp sites from selling shit. Well, they still do, so suck that jagex. You fucked up big.

They released bounty hunter and the trade limit soon after that, and bounty hunter had the same aspect as Pking just with a few tweaks.
The update wasn’t just to get rid of gp sellers, it was to get rid of the mass of botters and to stop sweat shops using stolen credit cards to buy membership. Jagex was going to get into a lot of trouble if they didn’t prevent it somehow.

A failure update was moving the party room. That was in camolet for a reason. It pumped that town out.

Does it even matter? You’re just finding reasons to have a go at them and to be honest, the party room was barely used. Hence why it was made available to F2P players.

Qc was added for the younger audience

Actually the original idea of it was so muted players could still communicate with other players.

I’m not going 2 even bother going into the coomunistic idea. Controlled prices, hidden staff, everyone COULD make the same amount of money. Old shit from other lands (good runescape) is worth mills. Sounds alot like soviet russia, yes?

The prices are controlled by the players. Proof of this is merching clans, they buy items at the highest price so the price goes up and then they sell them before they crash again.
Hidden staff? Jagex moderators do have other accounts that they use for their own leisure. Many Jmods have said that they still play runescape on other accounts.
Of course anyone could make the same amount of money, but obviously if you have a higher level in a certain skill than somebody else the chances are you can make more money than them.

And no, doesn’t sound anything like soviet russia.

/thread

Stop doing this. It makes you look like a moron.[/quote]

  1. People played for the shitty graphics.
  2. Less people botted then. Hence why I said I could have a conversation with someone. The newer community type in runescape just isnt as fun.
    3.500k People quit with the removal of pking. And this new bounty thing isn’t the same. Why should I have to wait 1 hour for a little circle to be 8/8 just to get ONE of there items, when I could get there inventory in a matter of minutes.
  3. If so, why can’t you say “sorry I cannot speak normally. I am muted”
  4. Who cares if it’s controlled by players, It’s still frustrating. I used to make millions just buying willows at varrock and selling them in draynor for a slightly higher amount. And this made alot of money. Now I can do this. Or like planks and steel bars at construction portal. It’s no longer possible for that kind of profit.
  5. /thread.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

Of course anyone could make the same amount of money, but obviously if you have a higher level in a certain skill than somebody else the chances are you can make more money than them.

And no, doesn’t sound anything like soviet russia.

reyx7:

/thread

Stop doing this. It makes you look like a moron.

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Off-topic: I quit Runescape because all my friends did in 2008. Been playing since '05.

item.source: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?

item.title: Why Do We Play Runescape Private Servers?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:22, topic:336098”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=432480.msg3175163#msg3175163 date=1270773414]
Prime example of inflation would be the Green D’hide Chaps
Only about a year ago they were around 150k. Now they’re 1.7m. Ridiculous imo.
[/quote]
I wouldn’t really call that inflation.
Back when Jagex released the Gold D’hide treasure trails was a really good source of gold. Years later new easier ways have been added which has resulted in less people doing clues which means less on the market so the price will increase.

I’d guess a lot of people play servers because they can be a mod or admin, get items such as party hats easier, and level up quicker. Truth be told: I’ve played Runescape a lot the past 3 days and made 25m and gained a good amount of levels. All these people whining about things Jagex have changed are all lame, nothings really that different.
Lazy generation we are
Runescape has a way better community than us which is what I like.
I think I’m staying there until this site returns to a tolerable state.[/quote]
PM me your rs name i wanna add youu <3

Read full topic
